overview:
J. Skyler Fernandes works in venture capital at Centripetal Capital Partners, an early stage venture fund, investing in a broad range of industries including: internet, telecom, healthcare, and energy.

Mr. Fernandes also leads the Missing Middle Initiative, launched at the World Economic Forum in Davos, focused on creating funds that invest $20K-$3M, a critical financing gap for businesses globally.

Previously, Mr. Fernandes worked in investment banking at Credit Suisse, in the asset securitization group at Societe Generale, and raised capital for Latin American corporations at Standard Bank.

Additionally, Mr. Fernandes serves as COO of the South African Chamber of Commerce in America (SACCA), is a serial entrepreneur co-founding a number of companies, and is a member of Echoing Green’s Social Investment Council. He graduated a year early from New York University summa cum laude, due to coursework at Harvard University where he studied quantum physics.
